business.headline: Budget 2025: Key proposals for FDs, and long-term savingsTax incentives for fixed deposits and boost middle-class savings could redefine savings strategies in Budget 2025.

Budget 2025: Date, time, and what to expectThe countdown to India's Union Budget 2025 has begun, with Nirmala Sitharaman set to present key policies and reforms on February 1.

ITI share price soars over 12%, hits all-time high. Know whyITI stock price: Earlier, some analysts had advised investors to book profits as it was approaching a critical resistance zone. However, it has now surpassed the resistance zone and is likely to continue its upward momentum.

Oil India, ONGC shares jump 5% today. What's fuelling the rally?The rally can be attributed to global policy measures aimed at economic revival, which investors believe could boost fuel demand and enhance earnings for upstream oil companies.

Explained: Why Jai Corp share price hit 52-week low todayThe steep decline in Jai Corp's share price over two sessions stems from a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), where Jai Corp holds a 32% equity stake.

5 tax-saving tips for young professionals in 2025Proactive financial planning helps young professionals save taxes, build wealth, and reach goals with strategies like early planning, goal-based investing, and health insurance, etc.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatilityThe downturn highlights the persistent volatility on Dalal Street, with investors uncertain about the short-term market trajectory. While auto and IT stocks had propelled a rally just a day ago, profit booking amid prevailing uncertainty appears to have weighed heavily on sentiment.

Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO: Check price band, GMP today  Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO last day: The initial public offering (IPO) of Leo Dry Fruits and Spices will close for bidding on Friday after having opened for subscription on January 1, 2025.

Sensex drops 400 points; Nifty slips below 24,100 in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 452.52 points to 79,491.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 93.25 points to 24,095.40 as of 9:42 AM.

Kabeer Biswas may call it quits as Dunzo battles cash crisis: Report The Bengaluru-based quick commerce platform has faced a challenging period over the last 12–18 months, marked by cash flow issues and difficulties in raising fresh funds.

Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Check allotment status, GMP and listing dateIndo Farm IPO allotment status:: Investors who wish to check Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment can do so by visiting the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the registrar's online portal, which is Mas Services Limited.

Can unregistered small businesses receive GST notices?The annual turnover threshold for GST registration is Rs 40 lakh for businesses supplying goods and Rs 20 lakh for service providers. Businesses below these limits are exempt, but exceeding them triggers registration and compliance requirements.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Situation in China not unusual: Health Ministry urges calm amid HMPV spread scareThe Health Ministry highlighted that India's robust surveillance systems and healthcare resources are well-equipped to handle respiratory illnesses, including those caused by the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV).

Twist in journalist's murder: Key accused identified as Mukesh Chandrakar's cousinMukesh Chandrakar, a 28-year-old journalist known for his hard-hitting investigative reports, recently exposed alleged corruption in a Rs 120-crore road construction project. He was found dead in a property belonging to Suresh Chandrakar, who was named in the corruption report.

5th Test Day 3 Live: Prasidh takes 3, Australia need 91 runs to win at LunchAustralia (AUS) vs India (IND), 5th Test Day 3 Live Updates, Reactions: India have taken the wickets of Sam Konstas and Marnus Labuschagne after a rapid start by the Australians, who are trying to make full use of the absence of Jasprit Bumrah. Bumrah did not take the field in India's second innings with the ball. Marnus Lasbuchagne has now joined Usman Khawaja at the crease.

Dense fog in Delhi, city witnessed longest zero visibility spell for 9 hoursAs many as 15 flights were diverted from Delhi airport and 81 trains were delayed on Saturday, as the national capital witnessed a record nine hours of zero visibility due to dense fog.

AUS vs IND: Virat Kohli riles-up Australian fans with 'sandpaper' gestures on Day 3Star India batter Virat Kohli was seen making sandpaper gestures towards the Australian crowd following the dismissal of Steve Smith on Day 3 of the fifth Test against Australia in Sydney.

Bengaluru techie suicide case: Atul Subhash's wife, in-laws get bailBengaluru techie Atul Subhash died by suicide on December 9 after alleging harassment by his wife Nikita Singhania and her family, including his mother-in-law.

Sydney Test: No Jasprit Bumrah with ball in huge blow for India on Day 3India's stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah opted out of bowling due to injury on Day 3 of the fifth Test against Australia at Sydney Cricket Ground in Sydney.

As Prashant Kishor sits on indefinite fast, his luxury vanity van feeds frenzyAmid Prashant Kishor's fast-unto-death, photos of his luxury vanity van parked at the site of the protest at Patna's Gandhi Maidan have gone viral, sparking buzz on social media.

PM to inaugurate Delhi section of Namo Bharat corridor, traffic advisory issuedThe 13-kilometre Delhi section of the Namo Bharat corridor between Sahibabad and New Ashok Nagar will be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday, January 5.

Princes William and Harry's ex-nanny's stepson among New Orleans attack victimsPrince William and his wife, Catherine, have expressed their deep sorrow following the death of Edward Pettifer, a 31-year-old British man with close ties to the royal family, in a New Year's Day terror attack in New Orleans.

BJP believes in Lord Ram, Samajwadis align with Babur: Yogi AdityanathUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that while "the BJP believes in Lord Ram, who is the symbol of Sanatana, the Samajwadi Party aligns with Babur, a symbol of destruction".

Kolkata gulped liquor worth Rs 137 crore during Christmas, New Year's EveKolkata witnessed record liquor sales of Rs 137 crore during Christmas and New Year, an eight-day spree that saw a 24 per cent increase compared to last year, with Alipore leading district-wise sales.

Rapper Nicki Minaj faces lawsuit alleging assault, emotional distressRapper Nicki Minaj is embroiled in a lawsuit filed by a former employee, Brandon Garrett, who alleges assault and emotional distress. The incident reportedly occurred backstage in Detroit, leading to Garrett's dismissal from her tour.

132 foreigners deported from Delhi in 2024 in crackdown on illegal immigrationIn 2024, police in Delhi deported 132 foreign nationals for staying in the national capital without valid documents. The individuals included Nigerians, Ivory Coast nationals, Guineans, Uzbeks, Ghanaians, Ugandans, and Senegalese nationals.

Nitish Kumar rejects Lalu's proposal to join INDIA bloc: Mistakenly gone off trackRejecting Lalu Prasad Yadav's proposal, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said that he had mistakenly gone off track twice in the past, but will now stay in the ruling NDA alliance.

Congress leader quits after 48 years, was 'upset' over poll ticket denial to wifeIn a letter to Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge, Mathura Dutt Joshi stated that he was compelled to resign from the party "out of frustration".

Barcelona lose request to keep playing Dani Olmo and Pau VictorDani Olmo and Pau Victor won't play for Barcelona in the second half of the season in the LaLiga. The Spanish football federation and LaLiga, in a joint statement, rejected the request.

AUS vs IND 5th Test: How will rain and pitch impact Day 3 proceedings in SydneyThe Sydney pitch continues to test batters with uneven bounce and seam movement. As Day 3 unfolds, India's lead of 145 looms large, with a target above 200 likely to challenge Australia on this tricky surface.

Devajit Saikia likely to be elected unopposed as BCCI secretaryDevajit Saikia submitted his nomination for the position of BCCI secretary on Saturday, while Prabhtej Bhatia filed his application for the treasurer role. Both officials are the sole candidates for their respective positions.

Sydney pitch not ideal for Test cricket: Sunil GavaskarFormer India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the green pitch in the ongoing fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground is not ideal for playing international red-ball cricket. After 11 wickets fell on day one, day two saw an additional 15 wickets tumble. India, having bowled out Australia for 181, took a slender four-run first-innings lead and reached 141/6 at stumps, extending their overall lead to 145.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma should play county cricket: Manjrekar Border Gavaskar Trophy, IND vs AUS: Sanjay Manjrekar said that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma should play county cricket to make a strong case for themselves before the Test series against England later this year.

Marcus Rashford out of Manchester United's trip to Liverpool with illnessManchester United forward Marcus Rashford will miss Sunday's Premier League clash against leaders Liverpool at Anfield because of illness, head coach Ruben Amorim said.

Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma unfollow each other, spark divorce rumoursChahal and Dhanashree's rumored split has left fans stunned. Reports of divorce, fuelled by their Instagram activity and deleted posts, signal an end to their once-adored love story. Neither has addressed the speculation, keeping fans guessing.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
